required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Surgical Stress in Patients Undergoing TURP Versus HOLEP Surgery by Measuring Perioperative Systemic Inflammatory Markers

lead_sponsor.agency: Adana City Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Adana City Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Aim of the study is to compare the systemic inflammatory markers and surgical stress response in patients undergoing HOLEP or TUR-P surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: Benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) is the most common disease in aging men worldwide, causing significant difficulties and resulting in bladder outlet obstruction. Basically, surgical techniques in patients with BPH are transurethral resection of the prostate (TURP), holmium laser enucleation of the prostate (HOLEP), and open prostoactemy surgery. There are many studies comparing the clinical outcomes of TURP and HOLEP surgery. However, to the best of our knowledge, there has not been a study comparing the effects of these two types of surgery on inflammatory markers and stress hormones.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline WBC (109 /L) at postoperative 0th and postoperative 24th hour
Change from baseline adrenaline (ng/L) at postoperative 0th and postoperative 24th hour
Change from baseline CRP (mg/L) at postoperative 0th and postoperative 24th hour
Change from baseline IL-6 (pg/ml) and TNF-alfa (pg/ml), at postoperative 0th and postoperative 24th hour
Change from baseline CD4+/CD8+ at postoperative 0th and postoperative 24th hourL-6 (pg/ml) and TNF-alfa (pg/ml)
Change from baseline cortisol (microg/dl) at postoperative 0th and postoperative 24th hour

arm_group.description: Patients with a prostate volume greater than 80 g
Patients with a prostate volume less than 80 g

intervention.description: Patients were subdivided into two groups according to their prostate volume

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA scores I-III patients
- having benign prostatic hyperplasia
- undergoing HOLEP or TURP surgery under general anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- immune system disease,
- diabetes mellitus,
- malignancy other than prostate disease,
- history of steroid use,

overall_official.affiliation: Adana City Training and Research Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Adana City Training and Research Hospital
